article.headline: Quinnipiac 78, Robert Morris 76
article.story: MOON TOWNSHIP, Pa. -- James Johnson scored 18 points, Ike Azotam 14 and Dave Johnson 12 -- all in the second half -- to help Quinnipiac rally past Robert Morris 78-76 on Thursday. The Bobcats trailed 35-27 at halftime, and shot 66.7 percent in the second half (16 of 24), including going 4 of 4 from long range. Quinnipiac (9-7, 2/3 Northeast Conference) outscored the Colonials 51-41 in the last 20 minutes. Quinnipiac led 78-72 with 17 seconds left, and Velton Jones hit a layup 7 seconds later to pull the Colonials within four. James Johnson failed to give the Bobcats a bigger cushion, missing both his free throws with 8 seconds left. Jones then made a layup with 2 seconds left for the final margin. James Johnson finished with 22 points, Dave Johnson 18 and Azotam 17 as Quinnipiac snapped a two-game losing streak. Jones paced the Colonials (12-6, 3-2) with 22 points.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
